intro: Hieracium hesperinum, commonly known as the western meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It produces yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
